page.title: 12The Churches in Exbourne
page.content: There are now two Churches in the village.The Parish Church of St.Mary has been in existance since at least 1266,it can be found in the adjoining block,ref.02600099. There are Norman features visible in the stonework.The pew ends and rood screen are richly carved.The barrel roof of both nave and chancel have carved bosses. Although the Parish Church is still an important part of village life,it is not as well attended as it was formerly. The Methodist Chapel was built in 1932 to replace a smaller one which is now a house.The Chapel is part of the Hatherleigh circuit. The Chapel still sees a good attendance,a smaller number than there used to be,though.
